channel.title: Blues guitar
channel.description:
I'm thinking of getting a steel string guitar, but I can't figure out the great naming schemes shops use. I like blues, so naturally I want it to sound like a Gibson l-1. But guitar shops only talk about western guitars, which is a much too broad spectrum. So does anyone know a good, not too expensive guitar that plays a nice bit of blues? Provide sound links if you can.
TY :P

item.title: Blues guitar
item.dc:creator: @Syfal Syfal
item.description:
@Syfal wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:4, topic:302213”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=398540.msg2957642#msg2957642 date=1252950238]
how much are you planning on spending?
[/quote]

Well, I have an electric guitar + amp that I don’t use anymore, so I’m thinking of trading it in. It’s still worth about €200-250, so anywhere near €300 budget.

I don’t know anything about the accoustic ones, but I like Les Pauls VERY much for playing blues…

I’d rather have an acoustic guitar.[/quote]

Interesting. BB King plays on Gibson guitars similar to the ES-355, and you can’t argue with that, because he is the King of Blues

If you like acoustic blues guitar, I rather like the guitar Eric Clapton used playing Layla on his Unplugged album.

Read full topic

item.title: Blues guitar
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

For 200-250 euro, you’d do a lot better if you just stopped worrying about the name on the headstock and went for a solid budget guitar

Read full topic

item.title: Blues guitar
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I did find a 1936 Gibson Kalamazoo KG-11 for €750, but I think it’s a bit too much for my budget.

Read full topic

item.title: Blues guitar
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

See if you can find a Gibson, and don’t worry about buying an older guitar, older is better! You should be able to find a used Gibson in your price range, and while it isn’t going to be an EXCELLENT guitar, it should be a very good one.

edit: Granted I usually play bluegrass on a banjo, I also play bluegrass on a guitar and even a little blues sometimes. I use my grandpa’s old 50s Gibson with the F holes, and it sounds pretty sweet to me.

Read full topic

item.title: Blues guitar
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

at that price range they are all the same

Read full topic

Well, I have an electric guitar + amp that I don’t use anymore, so I’m thinking of trading it in. It’s still worth about €200-250, so anywhere near €300 budget.

jensie:

I’d rather have an acoustic guitar.
